title: Drawing, "Sketches from South America.  Palm groves.  Landscapes.", 1853, probably May
markings:
Watermark: Parts of the letters K and F
(similar to 1917-4-68)
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite with figures at various locations, and at top right: 2 Grass.   3 shelving / earth bank sandy color broken / and interspersed with tufts of / foliage 4 Mountain / 5 Distant trees; and again at bottom: Bank of earth with margin of grass / 2/ 2 Mountains cloud capped.
description: Horizontal view of palms standing on a high river bank, shown from below is at top row, left; a river bank with an indentation, behind which a group of palms is seen, with a mountain visible in the right background and  with trees in the left background, are at right; and a mountain panorama rising behind a river bank is seen at bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches from South America.  Palm groves.  Landscapes.", 1853, probably May.
1853, probably May. Graphite on light gray paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-104.
